messageBody:
Can someone let me know if I'm organizing my tests properly to support
TDD and help my developers?

I'm trying to figure out the right way to organize my unit tests for a
system with mulitple CVS modules. I have a pyramid of project/modules
each with their own unit tests and with a "main" project which depends
on all below.

To Make it simple for developers to run the test via cmd line or in
eclipse:
- each project should have its own 'tests' ant target
- each project should have its own testAll class


At the top level, I'm not sure if I should just offer an ant target
'system-tests' or offer both an ant target an a systemTestAll class.

Duplication is naughty, but the ease of use payoff might make it worth it.

Eventually, I'll probably be moving to maven2 anyway....

Any ideas, suggestions or comments would be welcomed. Thanks.
